text: Allen Curtis Jenkins (born Alfred McGonegal; April 9, 1900 â€“ July 20, 1974) was an American character actor and singer who worked on stage, film, and television. Jenkins was born in Staten Island, New York on April 9, 1900. He studied at the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. In his first stage appearance, he danced next to James Cagney in a chorus line for an off- Broadway musical called Pitter-Patter, earning five dollars a week. ==Other websites== Category:1900 births Category:1974 deaths Category:Actors from Staten Island
title: Allen Jenkins
